name: fesapo
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, w2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, w2)

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))), wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))))

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, w2)
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))))
-| wi(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wi(w2, wn(w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, w2)
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wi(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wi(w2, wn(w1)))

|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, w2)
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))

comment: "Fesapo", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. No ` ph ` is ` ps ` , all ` ps ` is ` ch ` , and ` ps ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, EAO-4: PeM and MaS therefore SoP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
